tickets.subject: Additional Contact Number
tickets.raw_subject: Additional Contact Number
tickets.description:
Good evening.

Regarding the email below - I have sent netbet my email confirmation when I signed up for Gamstop in April 2018.

Is there any other confirmation they need apart from what I have sent them already?

Thanks
Sonia Thomas
Sent from my iPhone

On 30 Dec 2018, at 21:59, NetBet <support@netbet.com<mailto:support@netbet.com>> wrote:

__________________________________

[NetBet]




Hello Sonia!

Thank you for bringing this to matter to our attention.

Kindly note that we have now closed your account.

In order to further check the matter, we kindly ask you to send an email at helpdesk@gamstop.co.uk<mailto:helpdesk@gamstop.co.uk>, request a copy of your details registered with GamStop and to add us in CC.

Netbet supports responsible gaming, therefore should you have any concern about your gambling habits, we would advise you to contact https://www.begambleaware.org/

Should you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Best regards,

Olivia

Customer Service
NetBet

E-mail: support@netbet.com<mailto:support@netbet.com>
Phone number: +44 203 608 6024
Fax number: +44 207 760 7171

sonia2303

Original message
Hi,

I have previously self excluded from all casinos and with netbet.

I have been allowed to join today and deposit £400. I have an addiction and was hoping the exclusion I have in place with you and also Gamstop would avoid this happening.

I used my second email soniathomas626@yahoo.com<mailto:soniathomas626@yahoo.com> to join but my debit card, DOB, name and address is exactly the same as I have previously used. I don’t know why netbet has let me join and waste my money again - can you please exclude me again and surely my deposits should be refunded ? I am just fed up with this addiction and a small change of my email and you have let me do this again.

Can you help?

Sonia Thomas

Sent from my iPhone
For your reference this is Case #: 1525243



NetBet © 2017




[[eed529043dd2e01f4c5428cd1754aaa6aa5f9879-1337684747]]

tickets.subject: GAMSTOP - Update on your helpdesk enquiry 43475
tickets.raw_subject: GAMSTOP - Update on your helpdesk enquiry 43475
tickets.description:
Dear Gamstop

I have emailed you before about removing my self exclusion.  I would like it to be removed ASAP. I personally did not complete your form and in previous replies from yourselves you state that you use a 3rd party company to ask questions that I would only know the answers to.

You state on your website you get information from public registers to verify information that means info that are available to the public.

If someone can fraudulently open a credit card account or apply for loans and hack into email accounts as well as cause mayhem to multi million pound companies and the NHS. Plus not long ago William Hills website was brought down as well I am sure I can be excluded either on purpose or a genuine mistake.

Your website also says a self exclusion can be removed for certain reasons and my reasons are i personally did not complete your form and I have no idea of anyone I know fraudulently completing the form.

I do not have a gambling problem and I always keep within my set limits and this self exclusion is stopping me from having bet at the weekends as I cannot physically go to a bookies due to my disability.  I am sure you are also aware of the equality, disability and discrimination act.

I will answer any questions you have via email only.

Plus your website states in the terms that a gamstop exclusion can be terminated by yourselves if a person is in breach of terms and conditions. If you are not going to sort it out how do I breach the gamstop t & cs

I hope you use common sense and sort this out

Mark Bradley

tickets.subject: GAMSTOP - Update on your helpdesk enquiry 49494
tickets.raw_subject: GAMSTOP - Update on your helpdesk enquiry 49494
tickets.description:
Hi, 
I spoke with an advisor this morning about an issue with being allowed to gamble on a site yesterday evening called BCasino (gs technology ltd). I was allowed to register and bet despite being registered on gamstop since December. I am pretty devastated by this and the gamstop was my safety net.
Having spoke to the Casino it turns out that whilst all my details were the same the last digit on my phone number was wrong, I had by accidently registered an 8 instead of 9. I was told earlier it is now to the discretion of the casino.
I rasied it with the casino and they are refusing to refund. I have logged a complaint. They say Gamstop did not send a notification because the number was incorrect. I understand the complaint is not with you but I want to ask your help in logging my complaint. I have seen some recent news on a similar issue, and Gamstop reporting to be working on this, but actually nothing as stupid as a phone digit!
I am asking for your support to help me with my complaint. Help me understand how the technology works, is it really possible to bypass a safety net with a small error such as a phone number digit?! How would Gamstop communication with the casino? How exactly is the info shared, how does the information integrate? Is it really done per registration as they are suggesting? Or should they have all my info already? Do gamcare manage the recognition system or does the Casino create there own from a database??
I would really apriciate your help.
Thanks
James Green
Sent from Yahoo Mail on Android

tickets.subject: GAMSTOP - Update on your helpdesk enquiry 55639
tickets.raw_subject: GAMSTOP - Update on your helpdesk enquiry 55639
tickets.description:
Hi gavin‍

Thank you for contacting Gamstop. As discussed, you believe that you have unknowingly been signed up for the Gamstop self-exclusion service.

The online registration process is very robust, to the point where it is extremely unlikely that someone can register on your behalf. This process includes asking identity questions retrieved from our third party verification provider and a confirmation email being sent to your email address.

Registering on behalf of someone else, unless you are lawfully entitled to do so and authorised by them (for example, under a valid power of attorney) is a breach of the GAMSTOP Terms of use and could expose the third party to legal liability to both GAMSTOP and the person on whose behalf they registered.

In order for us to investigate this further, can you please provide us with the following information:


1. What message are you receiving to make you believe you have been excluded from online gambling. Please include names of any websites, screenshots of error messages and also the dates/times that you first noticed any restrictions.
2. The email address that you are trying to log in with when encountering these restrictions.

Once we have this information, we will be able to proceed with your request.

If you need any more assistance in the mean time, please contact us on 0800 138 6518 where we will be able to help further.

For additional support and help you can contact Gamcare at Freephone **0808 8020 133** or visit www.gamcare.org.uk.

Regards

Attached is a registration form which you will need to complete and return to us via email, at your earliest convenience.

Once we have received your registration form, we will send you a secure link to upload your supporting documentation. ****Please do not send any identity documents via email - the link we will send separately is the most secure way of providing them to us. ****

If we do not receive your registration form within 14 days of today's date, we will close your exclusion request. You can reinstate this at any time by calling us on the number below.

If you need any more assistance in the mean time, please contact us on 0800 138 6518 where we will be able to help further.

For additional support and help you can contact Gamcare at Freephone **0808 8020 133** or visit www.gamcare.org.uk.

Regards

tickets.subject: GAMSTOP - Update on your helpdesk enquiry 58683
tickets.raw_subject: GAMSTOP - Update on your helpdesk enquiry 58683
tickets.description:
Evening,

My account details – 
Address – Flat 4, Plane Tree Apartments, BB11 1RT 
DOB 26/11/94
Email – Daniel.morris@door4.com

I’m contacting you regarding my sudden account closure today. I signed up on the morning of the 23rd and was allowed to deposit not once, but three times over a several hour period. Subsequently upon these bets winning, the account was closed with a “Gamstop breach” being mentioned which is what I wish to resolve.

I have spent an hour on the phone with Gamstop this evening (with Richard White) discussing my Gamstop setup to which he confirmed the system has moved on over the past few months and therefore had to re enter some of my details. I have attached a PDF outlining my details and Gamstop, who I have CC’d, can confirm this if needed but I was told they don’t confirm this much as their process has changed. 

Richard White / Gamstop have added two emails to the account which may take a few days to show in the form of Daniel.morris@door4.com and skullprestige@hotmail.co.uk . As I had to update the account as the process had changed with Gamstop, only my main email showed on the account.

My biggest concern and what I am taking extremely seriously is the fact I cannot access my winnings. You cannot let me sign up for an account legitimately, deposit money, have the bet settle which I win and then close the account due to a “Gamstop” breach which in itself is not a legally binding service. I can understand Kwiff being careful that I am not exploiting the system hence no deposits being awarded but I am not concerned about that, I simply want to withdraw my winnings. Gamstop when I spoke to them were unsure why the details mattered also so can you please explain that?

Hopefully we can get this resolved as soon as possible otherwise I wish to make a formal complaint and I am willing to take this to the ombudsman if needed.

To summarise...
• I signed up legitimately and was allowed to deposit money.
• I won and the account was closed.
• I am on Gamstop but that does not mean I am not allowed to access my winnings. You cannot decide to keep my deposit AND anything won. 


Warm Regards
Daniel Morris
